title: Get Sessions
description:
---
title: List sessions
group:
  - Endpoints
---

List of all sessions

properties.name: page
properties.description: The number of page to start with (default 0, max 10000).

properties.name: size
properties.description: The number of page's size (default 25, max 100).

properties.name: email
properties.description: The email address that you have associated with a session via [identify](/docs/api/browser/methods#identify).

properties.name: tz
properties.description: IANA timezone. Default Europe/London if RelativeDateString is applied.

properties.name: total
properties.description: Total number of sessions matching the query

properties.name: website_id
properties.description: ID of the website where the session was recorded

properties.name: session_url
properties.description: URL to view the session in LiveSession dashboard

properties.name: creation_timestamp
properties.description: Unix timestamp when the session was created

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Total duration of the session in seconds

properties.name: end_timestamp
properties.description: Unix timestamp when the session ended

properties.name: active_time
properties.description: Total time the user was actively interacting with the page in seconds

properties.name: end_url
properties.description: The last URL visited during the session

properties.name: expiration_timestamp
properties.description: Unix timestamp when the session recording will expire

properties.name: last_event_timestamp
properties.description: Unix timestamp of the last event recorded in the session

properties.name: product
properties.description: Product identifier associated with the session

properties.name: tags
properties.description: Custom tags associated with the session

properties.name: last_seen_page_view_id
properties.description: ID of the last page view in the session

properties.name: seen
properties.description: Whether the session has been viewed in the dashboard

properties.name: referrer
properties.description: URL where the user came from before starting the session

properties.name: start_url
properties.description: First URL visited during the session

properties.name: visitor_first_session
properties.description: Whether this is the visitor's first session

properties.name: engagment_score
properties.description: Calculated engagement score for the session (0-100)

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the visitor if identified

properties.name: email
properties.description: Email address of the visitor if identified

properties.name: email_hash
properties.description: Hashed version of the visitor's email for privacy

properties.name: params
properties.description: Custom parameters associated with the visitor

properties.name: last_session_timestamp
properties.description: Unix timestamp of the visitor's last session

properties.name: first_session_timestamp
properties.description: Unix timestamp of the visitor's first session

properties.name: name
properties.description: Operating system name (e.g., Windows, macOS, iOS)

properties.name: count
properties.description: Total number of page views in the session

properties.name: clicks
properties.description: Total number of clicks during the session

properties.name: error_clicks
properties.description: Number of clicks on error elements

properties.name: rage_clicks
properties.description: Number of rapid clicks indicating user frustration

properties.name: param
properties.description: Name of the parameter that caused the error

properties.name: http_status_code
properties.description: HTTP status code associated with the error

properties.name: request_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the request that caused the error

properties.description: Name of the parameter that caused the error

properties.description: HTTP status code associated with the error

properties.description: Unique identifier for the request that caused the error

title: Create an alert
description:
---
title: Create alert
group:
  - Endpoints
---

Create alert

tabs.title: javascript
python
go
tabs.code:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://api.livesession.io/v1/alerts"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"name\":\"string\",\"events\":[{\"kind\":0,\"value\":\"string\"}],\"provider\":\"slack\",\"slack_channel_id\":\"string\",\"webhook_id\":\"string\"}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("accept", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := io.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the alert for easy identification

properties.name: events
properties.description: List of events that will trigger the alert

properties.name: value
properties.description: Value or threshold that triggers the alert

properties.name: provider
properties.description: Notification provider for the alert, `slack` or `webhooks`

properties.name: slack_channel_id
properties.description: Slack channel ID where notifications will be sent (required if provider is `slack`)

properties.name: webhook_id
properties.description: Webhook ID where notifications will be sent (required if provider is `webhooks`)

properties.name: events
properties.description: List of events that trigger the alert

properties.name: value
properties.description: Value or threshold that triggers the alert

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Whether the alert is currently active

properties.name: creation_date
properties.description: [ISO 8601](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the alert was created

properties.name: param
properties.description: Name of the parameter that caused the error

properties.name: http_status_code
properties.description: HTTP status code associated with the error

properties.name: request_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the request that caused the error

properties.name: param
properties.description: Name of the parameter that caused the error

properties.name: http_status_code
properties.description: HTTP status code associated with the error

properties.name: request_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the request that caused the error

title: Update an alert by ID
description:
---
title: Update alert
group:
  - Endpoints
---

Update alert by ID

tabs.title: javascript
python
go
tabs.code:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://api.livesession.io/v1/alerts/id"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"name\":\"string\",\"events\":[{\"kind\":0,\"value\":\"string\"}],\"provider\":\"slack\",\"slack_channel_id\":\"string\",\"webhook_id\":\"string\"}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("PUT", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("accept", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := io.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier of the alert to update

properties.name: events
properties.description: Updated list of events that will trigger the alert

properties.name: value
properties.description: Value or threshold that triggers the alert

properties.name: provider
properties.description: Updated notification provider for the alert

properties.name: slack_channel_id
properties.description: Updated Slack channel ID for notifications

properties.name: events
properties.description: List of events that trigger the alert

properties.name: value
properties.description: Value or threshold that triggers the alert

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Whether the alert is currently active

properties.name: creation_date
properties.description: [ISO 8601](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) timestamp when the alert was created

properties.name: param
properties.description: Name of the parameter that caused the error

properties.description: HTTP status code associated with the error

package main

import (
	"fmt"

	"net/http"
	"io"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://api.livesession.io/v1/webhooks"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"url\":\"string\",\"website_id\":\"string\",\"version\":\"string\"}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("accept", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := io.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

package main

import (
	"fmt"

	"io"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://api.livesession.io/v1/websites"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"host\":\"string\",\"description\":\"string\"}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("accept", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := io.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(string(body))

}
